value.title: Import images in Power BI from local sources
value.excerpt: In todays video I will show you how to import images in Power BI with the help of SQL Jason.  He shows in his blog post how you can import images in Power BI from your local folder for offline use. Read more about it here: http://sqljason.com/2018/01/embedding-images-in-power-bi-using-base64.html  and

value.title: Introduction to data modeling in Power BI
value.excerpt: In today's video we will go through the basics of data modeling in Power BI, to get you started fast and easy!  Links to mentioned resources: Flat tables vs models power bi: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=QWHE8N3AkT0  Get covid data in power bi: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4vfAz7XDuH0 or https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=r9i7CTdOsBo

value.title: Managing changing column names in Power Query #10: (M)agic (M)ondays
value.excerpt: In today's video, I will show how to manage column headers that changes names so your power bi file does not break when you refresh it.  This tip is from Lars Schreiber and here is the link to his blog post and how to do this in power query: http://power-bi-usergroup.blogspot.se/2015/12/dealing-with-tables-with-changing.html

value.title: Multilanguage Multilingual reports in Power BI

Fingers crossed I managed to explain myself!! :)  Here you can download all the pbix files: https://curbal.com/donwload-center

value.title: 3 ways to REDUCE DATA In Power BI Desktop (No Premium needed!)
value.excerpt: Sometimes you want to reduce data in Power BI Desktop so it's easier to work with. Then work with all the data in the Power BI Service. Patrick shows you 3 ways that can help do this without using Incremental Refresh or needing Power BI Premium!  📢 Become a member: https://guyinacu.be/membership

value.title: DAX! Uggg - Where do you start? | Power BI

Adam has some resources to get you started in your journey.  Beginning the journey:  MS Learn: User DAX in Power BI Desktop (Free) https://docs.microsoft.com/learn/paths/dax-power-bi/

value.title: Power BI URL Filter Updates (August 2018)
value.excerpt: In this video, Patrick looks at the recent updates to using the Power BI URL Filter. The update to using URL Filter parameters in Power BI include updates to operators along with the ability to use more than strings and spaces in table names!   Blog: https://powerbi.microsoft.com/en-us/blog/power-bi-report-url-filter-improvements/
